question: What is Continuous Integration (CI)?
answers: A meeting held every morning to discuss integration.
A process where developers integrate code into a shared repository frequently, usually verified by automated builds and tests.
The practice of writing code continuously without breaks.
A tool that automatically deploys code to production without testing.
correctAnswer: A process where developers integrate code into a shared repository frequently, usually verified by automated builds and tests.

question: In the context of Unit Testing, what is mocking?
answers: Creating fake versions of external dependencies (like databases) to isolate the code being tested.
Copying code from production to development.
Running tests in a virtual machine.
Making fun of bad code to encourage improvements.
correctAnswer: Creating fake versions of external dependencies (like databases) to isolate the code being tested.

question: When writing a unit test, what is an assertion?
answers: An error message returned by a failed test.
A statement that declares what the expected outcome of a test should be.
The command used to run the test suite.
A comment explaining the code.
correctAnswer: A statement that declares what the expected outcome of a test should be.

question: What is the correct npm command to install Jest as a development dependency?
answers: npm install -g jest-cli
npm install --save-dev jest
npm install jest
npm global install jest
correctAnswer: npm install --save-dev jest

question: What does Code Coverage measure?
answers: The percentage of lines of code that are executed during the test suite.
The number of bugs found in the code.
How many browsers the website supports.
The number of tests written per developer.
correctAnswer: The percentage of lines of code that are executed during the test suite.

question: Why did the author choose Jest over other frameworks like Mocha or Jasmine?
answers: It is the oldest and most stable framework.
It offers the best overall experience and is an excellent general-purpose framework.
It is the only framework that supports React.
It is built directly into Node.js.
correctAnswer: It offers the best overall experience and is an excellent general-purpose framework.

question: Which principle of maintenance is closely related to Continuous Integration?
answers: Use an Issue Tracker.
Prevent "Invisible" Failures.
Monitor Analytics.
Don't Procrastinate.
correctAnswer: Prevent "Invisible" Failures.

question: Which of the following is a potential downside of Integration Testing mentioned?
answers: They provide no value.
They are typically more complicated to set up and maintain than unit tests.
They only work on Windows.
They cannot be automated.
correctAnswer: They are typically more complicated to set up and maintain than unit tests.

question: What is the primary argument the author makes regarding the value of Quality Assurance (QA)?
answers: It is only necessary for large enterprise teams.
It prevents the need for future maintenance.
It ensures the project is completed under budget.
"Practice makes permanent," so practicing proper QA builds good habits.
correctAnswer: "Practice makes permanent," so practicing proper QA builds good habits.

question: Which tool does the book recommend for linting?
answers: JSLint
StyleLint
Prettier
ESLint
correctAnswer: ESLint

question: Why does the author recommend delineating Logic from Presentation?
answers: It allows Logic to be tested more easily with unit tests.
It allows designers to write backend code.
It makes the website load faster.
It prevents the need for integration testing.
correctAnswer: It allows Logic to be tested more easily with unit tests.

question: What is Test-Driven Development (TDD)?
answers: Using only automated tools to generate code.
Writing tests before writing the code that satisfies them.
Writing tests after the code is fully deployed.
Letting the QA team write all the code.
correctAnswer: Writing tests before writing the code that satisfies them.

question: What is the primary purpose of Linting?
answers: To compile the code into binary.
To automatically fix all logic bugs.
To minify the JavaScript code for production.
To identify potential errors and fragile constructs in the code.
correctAnswer: To identify potential errors and fragile constructs in the code.

question: Why might you need to refactor an application for testability?
answers: Because logic and presentation are too tightly coupled, making it hard to test logic in isolation.
Because Jest only works with modern JavaScript.
Because the file names are incorrect.
Because the code is too old.
correctAnswer: Because logic and presentation are too tightly coupled, making it hard to test logic in isolation.

question: Which statement best describes the difference between "Logic" and "Presentation" as defined in the text?
answers: Logic involves HTML/CSS, while Presentation involves JavaScript.
Presentation is easier to test than Logic.
Logic is the "pure intellectual domain" (business rules), while Presentation is how it is displayed to the user.
Logic and Presentation should always be mixed in the same file for efficiency.
correctAnswer: Logic is the "pure intellectual domain" (business rules), while Presentation is how it is displayed to the user.

question: What is the "ultimate" integration test for a web application described in the book?
answers: Reading the source code line-by-line.
Validating the database schema.
Rendering the app in a browser, manipulating it, and verifying behavior.
Checking if the server starts without crashing.
correctAnswer: Rendering the app in a browser, manipulating it, and verifying behavior.

question: According to the chapter, which of the following is NOT one of the four key dimensions of a comprehensive QA plan?
answers: Code Complexity
Functionality
Aesthetics
SEO (Search Engine Optimization)
correctAnswer: SEO (Search Engine Optimization)

question: Which type of test is described as "very fine-grained," testing single components to ensure they function properly?
answers: Integration Testing
Acceptance Testing
Unit Testing
System Testing
correctAnswer: Unit Testing

question: Which testing tool is primarily used in this book for Integration Testing?
answers: ESLint
Puppeteer
Mocha
Travis CI
correctAnswer: Puppeteer

question: How does Integration Testing differ from Unit Testing?
answers: It is faster and easier to set up.
It focuses only on the visual design of the website.
It does not require any tools.
It tests the interaction between multiple components or the whole system.
correctAnswer: It tests the interaction between multiple components or the whole system.
